title: General
stimulusHtml:
Part (a):

P (everyone gets a seat) =
P(X≤38)=.46+.30+.16=.92 OR                   =1−(.05+.02+.01)=.92 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@72C5@

Essentially correct if computes P(X ≤ 38) (except for minor arithmetic errors)


Partially correct if computes P(X = 38) = 0.16 or P(X > 38) = .08 or P(X < 38) = 0.76 or P ( X C 38) = 0.24 or gives 0.92 but does not show any work.


Incorrect if no calculation or nonsensical calculation (e.g.,  0.921, 38 40 =,    36.9 38 =0.971) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@50BF@ or only pure expected value calculations.

Part (b):

Y = number of no shows

y: 0 1 2 3 4 5

p(y): .01 .02 .05 .16 .30 .46


E(Y) = 0(.01) + 1(.02) + 2(.05) + 3(.16) + 4(.30) + 5(.46) = 4.1

OR

E(Y) = 26(.46) + 37(.30) + 38(.16) + 39(0.5) + 40(.02) + 41(.01) = 36.9

E(Y) = 41 - E (X) = 4.1


Essentially correct if (except for minor arithmetic errors) correctly computes expected value for number of no shows and indicates fully where the 36.9 and 4.1 come from.

Rounding this value to 4 is considered a minus, though can be forgiven with “about” or “approximately.”

Partially correct if correctly computes expected value of X = number of passengers who show up for the flight (instead of no shows) and shows work,

OR if incorrectly computes the first expected value but “subtracts,”

OR if correctly computes the first expected value but “subtracts” from the wrong number, OR if does not show work for 36.9 but subtracts to get 4.1.

Incorrect if is not an expected value or does not use all six outcomes in the expected value.

Part (c):

P(X=36 I not all seats are filled) = P(X=36 I X<38)=
P(X=36) P(X<38) = .46 .76 =.605 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4616@

Essentially correct if correctly computes the conditional probability. Complete notation could be considered a “plus.”

Partially correct if correctly computes P(X=36|  X<41)= 0.46 0.99 =0.465  or P(X=36  ‖X≤38)= 0.46 0.92 =0.5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@6825@

or incorrectly tries to solve the conditional probability (e.g., multiplies probabilities in numerator).

Incorrect if an unconditional probability is computed.
descriptions:
Minimal Response

Essentially correct on one part and in correct on the other two parts.
OR

Partially correct on one or two parts and incorrect on the other.
PII should be graded holistically (needs something elsewhere for a 1).

Developing Response


Essentially correct on two parts and incorrect on the other (except IEE – see above).
OR

Essentially correct on one part and partially correct on the other two parts. OR

Partially correct on all three parts.
OR

Essentially correct on one part, partial on another, and incorrect on a third part.

Substantial Response

Essentially correct on two parts and partially correct on the other part or incorrect on (a) and essentially correct on (b) and (c).

Complete Response

Essentially correct on all three parts.
